definition: to claim credit for other people's achievements (idiom)
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
day/sky/heaven
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
meritorious deed or service/achievement/result/service/accomplishment/work (physics)

sentences.english: Nobody can take credit for Wayne's development.
sentences.chinese: 没人能对鲁尼的成长贪天之功为己有。

definition: to claim credit for oneself
satisfied with one's accomplishment and arrogant as a result (idiom); resting on one's laurels and despising others
to get things done relying on others (idiom); with a little help from his friends
to put the blame on sb else
ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
to cover up one's faults (idiom)/to whitewash
not to claim personal credit for achievement (idiom)
to get undeserved rewards (idiom)
to lose one's head through material greed (idiom)
to blot out at one stroke/to reject out of hand/to deny without a hearing
selfless/impartial
to hold a sinecure (idiom)
variant of 一筆抹殺|一笔抹杀[yi1 bi3 mo3 sha1]
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
